intro: Hiraea heteropetala, commonly known as the variable leaf hiraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptical leaves that vary in shape and size. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the wet season. Hiraea heteropetala is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest undergrowth.
